column4: Which applications are best used for Remote Desktop between ubuntu and Windows?
Can VNC do it?
Cool, I figured vnc could probably do it, just wanted to see if anyone knew of some other options
what OS is the remote pc running that you want to connect to?
I would like to be able to connect to winxp and linux
then like levander said, vnc is a good way to go.
great I will have to check out the docs for vnc then... I was at their website a few days ago... it coul use a little beautification...
np, to connect from linux to a remote machine running vnc server just use Internet > Terminal Service Client and set Protocol to VNC.
If my buddies accross the internet and through a router, how could I dial into his machine? Would I have to configure his router to forward traffic or can I do it another way?
em i don't know anything about dialing in.. as in dial-up
not dialup... accross the internet- get to his pc even though hes behind a router
if there is no firewall in the way and he's not using NAT then you can go right in.. assuming the ISP hasn't blocked the port
if there are say three computers behind the router, what do I do to specify a certain one?
that probably means he is using NAT which means someone will have to configure the router
usually by connecting to a web interface on the router's IP and setting up Port Forwarding, or something
yah thats what i figured... i was hoping there could be an extension of some sort I would add to the address field in tsclient or something
basically just toss the routers ip in a web browser (on the network with the router) and click Advanced > Port Forwarding.. then set incoming connections on port 5900 to IP X
IP X being the static IP of the machine you want to connect to
assuming the machines behind the router are setup with static IP's
yah I know how to do that much thanks....
gl
thanks
for added security it is best to not use port 5900 when you configure the router... dead give away it's vnc
